016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.Intent;
020import android.util.Log;
021import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResult;
022import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultLauncher;
023import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
024import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
025import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
026import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
027import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
028import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
029import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount;
030import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
031import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
032import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service.GoogleSignInService;
033import io.reactivex.rxjava3.disposables.CompositeDisposable;
034import javax.inject.Inject;
035
036/**
037 * Provides access (for a UI controller or data-bound view) to the current signed-in state and
038 * {@link GoogleSignInAccount}. Additionally, the {@link #refresh()},
039 * {@link #startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher)}, {@link #completeSignIn(ActivityResult)}, and
040 * {@link #signOut()} methods are provided to offload the sign-in flow from the UI controller.
041 */
042@HiltViewModel
043public class LoginViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
044
045  private final GoogleSignInService signInService;
046  private final MutableLiveData<GoogleSignInAccount> account;
047  private final MutableLiveData<Throwable> throwable;
048  private final CompositeDisposable pending;
049
050  @Inject
051  LoginViewModel(@SuppressWarnings("unused") @ApplicationContext Context context,
052      GoogleSignInService signInService) {
053    this.signInService = signInService;
054    account = new MutableLiveData<>();
055    throwable = new MutableLiveData<>();
056    pending = new CompositeDisposable();
057    refresh();
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Returns a reference to {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} containing the
062   * active {@link GoogleSignInAccount}, for observation by a UI controller (or a data-bound
063   * {@link android.view.View}).
064   *
065   * @return
066   */
067  @SuppressWarnings("JavadocDeclaration")
068  public LiveData<GoogleSignInAccount> getAccount() {
069    return account;
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Returns a reference to {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Throwable&gt;} containing the most recent
074   * exception thrown by a ReactiveX task, for observation by a UI controller (or a data-bound
075   * {@link android.view.View}). The contents of the {@link LiveData} are reset at the start of each
076   * new ReactiveX task subscribed to by methods in this class.
077   *
078   * @return
079   */
080  @SuppressWarnings("JavadocDeclaration")
081  public LiveData<Throwable> getThrowable() {
082    return throwable;
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Starts the silent refresh/sign-in flow of Google Sign In. If an exception is thrown in this
087   * phase of the Google Sign In flow, it is not treated as an error; instead, it simply indicates
088   * that the silent refresh failed, and a Google Sign In screen must be presented to the user.
089   */
090  public void refresh() {
091    throwable.setValue(null);
092    signInService
093        .refresh()
094        .subscribe(
095            account::postValue,
096            (throwable) -> account.postValue(null),
097            pending
098        );
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Starts the visible Google Sign In flow, in which the standard Google Sign In form is presented
103   * to the user.
104   *
105   * @param launcher Callback that will receive the result of the Google Sign In process.
106   */
107  public void startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher<Intent> launcher) {
108    signInService.startSignIn(launcher);
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Completes the Google Sign In flow, using the provided {@link ActivityResult} (passed to the
113   * {@link ActivityResultLauncher} callback provided in the invocation of
114   * {@link #startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher)}).
115   *
116   * @param result Google Sign In {@link ActivityResult} passed to the
117   *               {@link ActivityResultLauncher} callback.
118   */
119  public void completeSignIn(ActivityResult result) {
120    throwable.setValue(null);
121    signInService
122        .completeSignIn(result)
123        .subscribe(
124            account::postValue,
125            this::postThrowable,
126            pending
127        );
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Starts the sign-out process of the Google Sign In flow. Note that even if this process throws
132   * an exception, the {@link GoogleSignInAccount} contained in the {@link LiveData} returned by
133   * {@link #getAccount()} is cleared.
134   */
135  public void signOut() {
136    throwable.setValue(null);
137    signInService
138        .signOut()
139        .doFinally(() -> account.postValue(null))
140        .subscribe(
141            () -> {},
142            this::postThrowable,
143            pending
144        );
145  }
146
147  @Override
148  public void onStop(@NonNull LifecycleOwner owner) {
149    DefaultLifecycleObserver.super.onStop(owner);
150    pending.clear();
151  }
152
153  private void postThrowable(Throwable throwable) {
154    Log.e(getClass().getSimpleName(), throwable.getMessage(), throwable);
155    this.throwable.postValue(throwable);
156  }
157
158}
